page.title: 17Religion in Stamford Bridge
page.content: In Stamford Bridge we have the Church of England,the Methodist Chapel and the church at Low Catton.The church in the village was built in 1857 and the one in Low Catton dates back to the 13th Century.The Methodist church is on Main Street.Sunday School meets in the Chapel school-room at 10.40am.The Church of England's Sunday School meets in a room at the Primary School. We learn stories from the bible and about the life of Jesus.Dr.Bailes is the vicar for both the churches in the village and Low Catton.The Chapel has a different vicar each week.At Harvest time all the churches display bread, wheat and other produce donated by the villagers.These are given to the old people after the service.At the Christmas service the children are allowed to build a model of the Nativity during the service.
